hero.badge: Portable PDFs from your beook library
hero.title: No lock-in. No limits.
hero.description:
The real advantage of Exporting to PDF is independence.
A PDF isn't tied to a vendor licence, access cannot be revoked,
it doesn't need updates and it can be used on any device.
You keep control of your own study materials.

benefits.title: Why export to PDF?
benefits.subtitle: It's about ownership, portability, and long-term access.

items.title: Keep access long-term
items.description: A PDF archive isn't tied to a platform or a changing licence model. If access changes later, your copy still opens.

items.title: Use any device or reader
items.description: Read on older Windows, Linux, tablets, or the e-reader you prefer. PDFs move with you — even to devices beook doesn't support.

items.title: Backup and organize
items.description: Store your books alongside your notes, sync to your own cloud, version them, print them, and keep them organized in your workflow.

items.title: Make it yours
items.description: Highlight, annotate, copy excerpts, and build your own study documents — within your rights and the content's licence.

useCases.title: Made for learners and educators
useCases.subtitle: From classrooms to self-study, this is for people who care about keeping their learning close.

items.title: Students
items.description: Keep course materials accessible across semesters, devices, and apps — and study on whatever you have available.

items.title: Teachers and trainers
items.description: Prepare lesson packs, print handouts, and annotate content while keeping an archive you can reuse year after year.

items.title: Lifelong learners
items.description: Build a durable reference library for certifications, manuals, and learning content — independent from a single vendor.

items.title: Download the app
items.description: Get the latest release and run it on Windows 10+.

items.title: Pick a book
items.description: Select what you want to archive or move to other devices.

items.title: Press Download
items.description: Generate a portable PDF you can store, back up, or print.

items.title: Read anywhere
items.description: Open the PDF in your preferred reader and move it to devices you own.

download.title: Download Beook
download.description: Get the latest release for Windows 10+. The PDFs you export can be opened on practically any device.

notes.title: Runs locally
notes.text: your library stays on your machine.

notes.title: Portable output
notes.text: move PDFs to e-readers, Linux, older Windows versions, or print.

notes.title: Make it yours
notes.text: copy/annotate/organize the exported PDF the way you want.

items.q: Is this the official beook app?
items.a: No. This is an independent open source project and is not affiliated with Ionesoft or beook.

items.q: Does beook already support offline reading?
items.a: Yes — and that's great. Exporting to PDF is mainly about long‑term control and device freedom (not being tied to one app or licence model).

items.q: What can I do with the exported PDFs?
items.a: You can open them in standard PDF readers, move them between devices, and annotate or organize them like any other document.

items.q: Is it legal to export my books?
items.a: Did anyone really read the Licence? You paid for the content, you should be able to use it as you want. This site is informational and does not provide legal advice.
On GitHub — the repo includes documentation and the issue tracker for questions and compatibility notes.

footer.tagline: Export your beook content to a portable PDF archive you can keep.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: Beook2PDF is an independent project and is not affiliated with Ionesoft or beook. Please respect the intellectual property rights of content creators and only export content you are allowed to export.
